title.rendered: Calgary Stampede 2021: Live Stream, TV Schedule, Start time

content.rendered:
Calgary Stampede 2022 will run from Friday, July 8 – Sunday, July 17 at the Calgary Stampede Grandstand, Calgary, Canada. This event is known as the “Greatest Outdoor Show on Earth,” and you won’t want to miss it. Why is that? Calgary Stampede will host rodeo’s top athletes from Canada and the United States, returning to the country after an extended absence.

Watch NFR 2023 Live Online - SUBSCRIBE HERE

NFR 2023 Streaming info
Streaming
The Cowboy Channel (real-time) Watch Here
RFD-TV (real-time) Watch Here
Cowboy Channel Plus (International) Watch Here

 

It’s important to recognize that the Calgary Stampede includes so much more than just a rodeo since it also consists of a derby, parade, exhibition, and market. In 2022, over 300,000 people are expected to attend the Calgary Stampede parade, which includes marching bands, Mounties, and 150 floats. In this detailed, lengthy article, you’ll find the information you may need if you want to watch Calgary Stampede 2022 from anywhere in the world.

Calgary Stampede 2021
Venue Calgary Stampede Grandstand
Start Date Friday, July 9, 2021
End Date Sunday, July 18, 2021
Start Time 1:30 pm – 4:00 pm (MT)
Location Calgary Stampede Grandstand, Calgary, Canada
TV Broadcaster CBC TV Sportsnet and Sportsnet ONE

When is the Calgary Stampede 2022?

When you talk or hear about the largest rodeo event in the world, Calgary Stampede comes into the picture as one of the Greatest Outdoor Show on Earth. Calgary hosts this rodeo event every year in July, which attracts fans and athletes from all over the world. There are exciting competitions and rodeo actions during the 10-day Calgary Stampede. In the coming year, 2022, the Calgary Stampede festival will take place on Friday, July 8 through Sunday, July 17.

Where is the Calgary Stampede 2022 held?

We know how the COVID-19 pandemic affected the entire sports world, and most events, including Calgary Stampede, were shuttered. This was the first time in the event’s history. The Stampede is expected to return in 2022, running from July 8- July 17 at the Calgary Stampede Park, Calgary, Alberta, Canada.

Where is the Calgary Stampede Park?

I bet you might be wondering where the home of the Greatest Outdoor Show on Earth is located.

The Calgary Stampede Park address is 1410 Olympic Way SE, Calgary, AB T2G 2W1, Canada.  The venue is not only home to the 10-day July Stampede event, but it also hosts a variety of concerts and other events throughout the year. Whether on foot or by car, the Calgary Stampede Park is centrally located southeast of downtown Calgary along MacLeod Trail S.E. between 12 Avenue southeast and 25 Avenue southeast.  Visitors can utilize public transportation and parking options all year long.

Let’s get you started on some of the best channels to watch 2022 Calgary Stampede.

Watch Calgary Stampede 2020 Live Stream

Calgary Stampede is scheduled for July 9-18, 2021. This year’s broadcast schedule includes exclusive daily television coverage on CBC TV Sportsnet and Sportsnet ONE. Livestream broadcast is available at CBCSports.ca

All viewers outside of Canada will find live daily coverage on WranglerNetwork.com

CBC

Another excellent option for watching 2022 Calgary Stampede is CBC which includes exclusive daily television coverage of the rodeos’ actions.  You can watch via CBC TV Sportsnet or Sportsnet ONE, or better yet, you can watch the live stream online at CBCSports.ca.

The Cowboy Channel

The Cowboy Channel has been a 24-hour television network dedicated to western sports and the western lifestyle since December 27, 2017. The good news is that the Cowboy Channel is available on DIRECTV channel 603.

Here are some of the available options you can use to access the Cowboy Channel.

  • Sling TV’s Heartland Package
  • The Cowboy Channel Plus App
  • AT&T (Channel 566)
  • Verizon FiOS TV
  • Charter Spectrum
  • Comcast
  • Suddenlink

Enter your zip code and your pay-tv provider here to see if you can watch THE COWBOY CHANNEL in your area.

RELATED NEWS: Watch Caldwell Night Rodeo 2022 live stream CNR online

Wrangler Network

Rodeos across the United States are covered live by the Wrangler Network, along with bull-riding competitions highlights and statistics, and a host of other events. You can catch live coverage of Wrangler Network’s games each day on WranglerNetwork.com if you live outside of Canada.

Dish Network

You can watch Calgary Stampede via Dish Network by purchasing the Dish Welcome Pack for $19.99/month. It’s advantageous to purchase this basic Dish package since you won’t have to worry about price hikes, as it’s the case with Xfinity or DirecTV. This is because the monthly fee doesn’t change at all, and it is a standard rate.  What’s more, the Dish Welcome Pack comes with 40+ channels, where you can watch TV shows as well as other epic sports events. For Calgary Stampede coverage, access Cowboy Channel 232 (HD) on the Dish Network.  

DirecTV Now

It would be best to know that DirecTV Now and AT&T TV Now are the same thing, and it allows for the viewing of over 65 live channels at $40/month. You can also enjoy specials and offers on the NFL Package or even get a 55% off DirecTV Programming packages available for all Senior Discounts Members. It’s necessary to sign up and obtain the free 7-day trial to take advantage of the free options. The free trial period allows anyone to watch the Prescott Frontier Days Rodeo 2021 live and to cancel for free before the trial expires. To watch, simply turn on The Cowboy Channel 603 (HD).

Cox

Customers 60 years and older who earn less than $24,000 can get a 30 percent discount off the basic cable service at Cox by applying at their local Council on Aging. All major MSOs now distribute the Cowboy Channel, including Cox, DISH channel 232, Verizon FIOS channel 246, Suddenlink channel 365, AT&T U-Verse channel 566, Comcast, Mediacom, Charter Spectrum, and many other rural cable systems. Just tune to The Cowboy Channel 260 (HD).

RFD-TV Now

You can watch over 90+ channels via RFD-TV Now including NFR, and other on-demand shows such as The Best of the Marty Stuart Show, Opry Encore, FarmHer, Ag PHD, and Hee Haw. On top of that, you can catch the Market Day Report and the Rural Evening News daily.

PRCA Rodeo Performances

Two main characteristics determine a rodeo. That’s the competitors’ skill and not forgetting the quality of the bulls, horses, and steers. There are world-class rodeo competitors and animals displayed at Stampede Rodeo. At the World’s Largest Outdoor Rodeo, cowboys and cowgirls face off every afternoon at 1:30 p.m. in a display of skill and grit that builds towards Showdown Sunday.

Stampede Rodeo Events

The PRCA (Professional Rodeo Cowboys Association) is the governing body of the Calgary Stampede Rodeo, which includes both judged and time events performances. Competition between cowboys and cowgirls is usually for the highest score or shortest time. It’s a fun rodeo competition that attracts several cash prizes to be won by the top athletes, who also get commemorative belt buckles. 

Here are the six Pro Rodeo performances at the Calgary Stampede 2022.

  • Bull Riding

Bull Riding at Calgary Stampede is a world-renowned spectacle in which cowboys pit their nerves against a bull. The ropes wrapped around the bull are thickly braided, complete with a handhold. When the ride is over, cowbells are hung from the rope to allow it to fall when it has been weighed down. Bull riders hold the rope tight by gripping it tightly. To avoid breaking loose before the end of the ride, he should avoid straightening his arm and keeping his hand from breaking loose. Cowboys don’t need to move their feet, and staying on is hard enough. However, if they spur, they get higher marks.

  • Saddle Bronc

Saddle Bronc is about maintaining the rhythm between a cowboy and his horse.

Riders move their feet in time with a bronc’s bucking action to the back of the saddle coming from the horse’s neck. Using a braided rein attached to the horse’s halter, the cowboy balances himself by holding onto it. It’s possible to pull him over the front, especially when his hand placement is too low. If the hand placement is too high, he may be thrown off the back before the eight seconds are up.

  • Barrel Racing

The rider and the horse must be in close partnership and possess control and attention to detail when Barrel Racing. A contestant races across the scoreline in a cloverleaf pattern by circling three barrels. The winner is determined by a short time, such as a hundredth of a second measured with an electronic eye timer.  Although riders may touch a barrel, they will receive a five-second penalty if they knock one over.

  • Steer Wrestling

During this event, cowboys compete against the clock and must demonstrate strength and coordination. Steer wrestlers wait behind a rope barrier on horseback. They are given a 12-ft head start when the steer is released upon showing a nod. He chases the steer with his horse, then drops to the ground and grabs its horns, fighting to control it. He needs to roll the steer on the ground, and it’s must be on its feet. The time is recorded as soon as the animal is on its side with all legs extended.  The steer must be kept running straight with the help of an additional horse, ridden by a hazer.

  • Bareback

Riders hold on to leather handholds as they extend their feet forward, holding onto riggings, which are pads wrapped around the bucking horse’s girth. In a spurring motion, the rider pulls his feet back toward the rigging. A higher spur means a higher score. Cowboys’ arms are heavily stressed as they absorb most of the horse’s power, and they are required to hold on for at least 8 seconds.

  • Tie-Down Roping

Tie-Down Roping is where a cowboy with his partner must rope and tie an animal.  It’s one of the oldest ranching tasks that involve speed, skill, and finesse. On horseback, the cowboy waits behind a rope barrier. He then gets 10 feet of a head start when a nod is given to release the calf. To rope the calf, the cowboy must dismount from his horse, reach it on the run, turn it on its side, and tie three of the animal’s legs. A cowboy’s hands are thrown in the air when the time is called, and the calf must be released immediately.

Calgary Stampede Evening Show

This evening show is unlike anything you’ve ever experienced before, as it combines live music, celebration, grit, and glamour to create an unforgettable experience.

The Bell Grandstand Show and Broncs After Dark will be new events for Stampede 2022 only. 

Witness some of the most high-energy western events Calgary Stampede has to offer as you cheer on talented athletes and teams. Get ready for a day full of music and adrenaline-filled performances leading to a night filled with fireworks.

  • Terri Clark: 5 Nights Only | July 8 – 12, 2022
  • High Valley: 5 Nights Only | July 13 – 17, 2022
  • Bell Grandstand Show: A spectacular show filled with stunts, pyrotechnics, and music.
  • Broncs After Dark: Experience our brand-new nighttime experience for Stampede 2022.

Dog Bowl

Do you love dogs? Then this is the show for you!

The Canine Athletes are an elite troupe of highly-trained pupper athletes who are paws-down the most lovable performers around. From agility poles and dock-diving, to frisbee and freestyle dancing, this action-packed show is sure to impress the whole family.

Daily shows at 1:30 p.m., 4:30 p.m., & 7:30 p.m.

New location for 2021: located in front of the Saddledome

Fireworks Spectacular

On Friday, July 8, the Calgary Stampede will host a province-wide fireworks display to celebrate the determination and resilience of our great province. There will be Fireworks Spectaculars at Edmonton, Red Deer, Lethbridge, and Calgary. The event acknowledges all Albertans and celebrates our shared goals through the night sky filled with a magnificent fireworks display.

Music

From country to rock, pop to folk, today’s stars to rising talent, there’s a lot of music to grace the stages of the Calgary Stampede.

Nashville North

This incredible venue—for those over 18—has hosted acts like Johnny Reid, Eric Church, the Nitty Gritty Dirt Band and so many more. See below for this year’s Nashville North headliners.

  • BUCK THE LINE
  • TWO WAYS TO TWO-STEP

Stampede Summer Stage

THE TREWS
Thursday July 8th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

CLASSIFIED
Friday July 9th, 2021 @ 9:15 pm

DEAR ROUGE
Saturday July 10th, 2021 @ 8:00 pm

MICHAEL BERNARD FITZGERALD
Saturday July 10th, 2021 @ 9:30 pm

THE SHEEPDOGS
Sunday July 11th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

DEFAULT
Monday July 12th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

SAM ROBERTS BAND
Tuesday July 13th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

STARS
Wednesday July 14th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

MONSTER TRUCK
Thursday July 15th, 2021 @ 7:15 pm
LEARN MORE

BIG WRECK
Thursday July 15th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

MARIANAS TRENCH
Friday July 16th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

THE FUNK HUNTERS
Saturday July 17th, 2021 @ 9:15 pm

BLUE RODEO
Sunday July 18th, 2021 @ 9:00 pm

Stampede Showband

A Calgary Stampede Foundation Youth Program, the world famous Calgary Stampede Showband is comprised of 140 dedicated community youth.

With over 100 appearances during the 10-day festival, there are many great opportunities to experience this versatile ensemble’s innovative performances and unique visual entertainment. Featured twice daily on the Saddledome Steps, the Rodeo, and many other pop-up performances throughout the park, these talented youth performers are proud to bring entertainment and their unique brand of western hospitality direct to you!

RELATED NEWS: How to Watch PBR World Finals Live Stream Online

Big Four Roadhouse

Come off the rush of the Midway and step into The Big Four Roadhouse. The upbeat, friendly and relaxed atmosphere is the perfect place to grab a cold drink and kick back with friends for some all-around good times.

BROTHERS BANDIT
July 8 – 12, @ 7 pm, 8:15 pm & 9:30 pm

JORY KINJO
July 13 – 18 @ 7pm, 8:15pm & 9:30pm

New Midway Food

You won’t want to miss all of the mouth-watering flavors in 2022. Here you’ll discover new midway foods that range from sweet to spicy. They include:

  • Sweet Teriyaki Cauliflower Wings
  • Flamin’ Hot Cheeto Mini Donuts
  • Blueberry Mini Donuts on a Stick
  • Potato-Less Cheese Curd Poutine
  • Double Donut Chicken Burger
  • Peanut Butter Bacon Burger
  • Cool Ranch Dorito Corn Dog
  • Seafood Ramen Poutine
  • Rainbow Grilled Cheese
  • Cotton Candy Soft Serve
  • Butter Chicken Bombs
  • Rainbow Street Corn
  • Louisiana Gator Bites
  • French Fry Corn Dog
  • Street Corn Coconut
  • Pickle Lemonade
  • Golden Kraken
  • Pork Intestine
  • Sushi Tacos
  • Spamalot

Eevent Spaces

  • BMO Centre
  • Enmax Park
  • Grandstand
  • Nutrien Western Event Centre
  • Rotary House
  • The Big Four Roadhouse

Guest Services

Amenities

Bank Machines

  • There are four ATMs conveniently located throughout Stampede Park:
  • BMO Centre – across from Hall C
  • Corral/BMO Centre – Main Entrance
  • Big Four Building – Main Lobby
  • Grandstand – Main Level

Park Accessibility

The Calgary Stampede is committed to ensuring our Park is accessible to all guests, of all abilities.

Lost & Found

Stampede Park Lost and Found is located in the Security Office. Please call 403.261.9347 to inquire about lost items.

HOURS OF OPERATION:
Year-Round – Mon, Wed & Fri 9 a.m. until 2 p.m.

Stampede Week (July 2– July 12) Daily 9 a.m. until 12:30 a.m.

Post Stampede (July 13 – July 20) Monday – Friday 9 a.m. until 2 p.m.

Medical

Medical coverage may be contracted for any event and maybe a requirement for some events. Please contact Show Management for more information.

Final Words

This festival celebrates the unique spirit of the West, which is made up of the people, the traditions, the values, the animals, and the land. In addition to our world-renowned Stampede, we provide several facilities year-round, western events, and youth and agriculture programs critical to the quality of life in Calgary and southern Alberta. With a theme of “We’re Greater Together,” we’re a volunteer-supported, not-for-profit organization dedicated to preserving and celebrating our western cultures, heritage, and community spirit. The Calgary Stampede invests all of its revenue into its facilities and programs.
